It is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest understories, where it thrives in cool and humid conditions. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually clustered in spikes, and it produces small, dark-colored berries as its fruit.
